info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 8:46PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN JEFFERSON... SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIANA...SOUTHWESTERN BEAVER...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 915 PM EDT... At 846 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Cumberland, or near Wellsville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... East Liverpool, Wellsville, Ohioville, Midland, Chester, Industry, New Cumberland, Shippingport, Newell, New Manchester, Empire, Stratton, Georgetown, Hookstown, Frankfort Springs, Glasgow, Tomlinson Run State Park, Raccoon Creek State Park, and Hanover Township. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
